intro: Uraspermum nudum, commonly known as the naked seed plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, dry seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils. Uraspermum nudum is notable for its minimal floral structures and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
